**Emma’s Torch**

*Emma’s Torch is a non-profit social enterprise. Our mission is to train refugees, asylees, and survivors of human trafficking in the culinary arts and to empower them to build meaningful careers in the culinary industry. Our students participate in a full-time, paid, culinary training program in preparation for job placement. We celebrate what they have to offer, and we affirm their innate value and power. Emma’s Torch honors Emma Lazarus, a staunch advocate for refugee rights whose poem, “The New Colossus,” adorns the Statue of Liberty.*

*Founded in 2016, Emma’s Torch piloted our signature classroom café program in 2017. In May 2018, we opened our first full-service restaurant in Brooklyn, receiving recognition from outlets such as the New Yorker, the Today Show, Bloomberg, CNN, and the Guardian, among many others. The restaurant, which houses our Culinary Training Program, has cemented Emma’s Torch as a community institution. In response to increased demand for our services, we opened another program site at the main branch of the Brooklyn Public Library in April 2019, enabling us to amplify our impact and to engage the community at large in supporting our mission. Prior to COVID-19, the earned revenue from our restaurant, café, and catering businesses offset 50% of our budget, providing a steady and sustainable model for growth. This allowed us to do more with every dollar donated. More information can be found at* *EmmasTorch.org**.*

We value diversity and inclusion, and encourage qualified applicants regardless of age, gender, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, marital status, or physical ability to apply.

**Job Description**

The Teaching Chef will work alongside the Culinary Director to provide a safe and constructive work environment for the students, teach the students all aspects of production and service in a restaurant environment, maintain a high standard of cleanliness, organization, & food quality, and manage the day-to-day back of house & service operations. The Teaching Chef will also be the point of contact when the Culinary Director and/or GM are not present. The Teaching Chef is a unique opportunity to work in a quick service environment that allows you to be actively involved in all aspects of the operation, as well as practice and develop your teaching and leadership skills as you work with our unique student base. *This position must be available to work weekends.*

**Key Responsibilities**

Student Training & Support (50%)

* Responsible for BOH student training beginning with contributing to the culinary curriculum, initial Cafe training sessions, and throughout the service portion of the program
* Act as a mentor and lead by example– professionalism, work ethic, organization, and sanitation
* Promote a safe, inclusive, challenging, and sociable working environment
* Maintain open communication with students and Program team

Cafe Profitability & Community Engagement (20%):

* Monitor menu sales in coordination with the Culinary & Operations teams
* Contribute input to guide marketing in order to improve sales
* Engage and develop guest relationships to drive repeat business
* Develop relationships with local stakeholders and the broader Brooklyn community to increase organizational visibility
* Assist with off-site catering events as needed

Kitchen Operations (30%)

* Setting and maintaining all service standards for the kitchen
* Ordering supplies and maintaining stock levels
* Assist with scheduling, menu development, costing, inventory, labor control, and DOH guidelines
* Family meal and creation of specials with an understanding of product utilization, organization, and cleanliness of storage areas
* Maintain facilities and equipment according to DOH standards

**Goals & Objectives**

Cafe Operations

* Definition: Optimize systems across the Cafe in close collaboration with the Operations team.
* Quantitative target: Cafe FY23 revenue target of $420,000, Catering revenue target of $300,000
* Tracking: Analytics provided by Toast and Marginedge.
* Check-in: Weekly check-ins with the Culinary Director, contributing to monthly reports.

Student Training & Support

* Definition: Directly guide and support students through service to meet curriculum goals and provide an excellent guest experience.
* Quantitative target: Contributing to the FY32 goals of 100% graduation rate, 95% job placement, and long-term career growth
* Tracking: Student performance reports provided to both the Operations and Program teams\\*
* Check-in: Weekly summary added to the All Staff agenda

Cafe Profitability

* Definition: Improve cafe systems and guest relations to drive profitability to partially fund the NY-based program.
* Quantitative target: Cafe FY23 revenue target of $420,000
* Tracking: Analytics provided by Toast and Marginedge are monitored with direct guidance and support from the Operations Director.
* Check-in: Weekly check-ins with the Culinary Director, contributing to monthly reports.

QUALIFICATIONS

Experience:

* Culinary Arts degree or equivalent training; 1-3 years progressive experience in the Back of House, including butchery, events & catering, and all meal periods.
* Committed interest in teaching, mentoring, and the advancement of culinary arts in the restaurant industry

Skills and Approach to Work:

* Passion and enthusiasm for our mission
* Team player with a positive, can-do attitude
* Understanding of culturally conscious conflict resolution skills and an ability to handle situations with an awareness of and sensitivity to trauma
* Committed interest in teaching, mentoring, and the advancement of culinary arts in the restaurant industry
* Outstanding communication, supervisory, and problem-solving skills
* Self-motivated with an excellent work ethic

* Able to work Full-Time, mornings, nights, and weekends as needed
* Ability to perform essential job functions when working under stress, in fast-paced environments

COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION

Emma’s Torch encourages individuals of all ethnic, racial, and socioeconomic backgrounds to apply for this position. We are committed to maximizing the diversity of our organization, as we want to engage all those who can contribute to this effort.

Emma’s Torch is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy, parental status, genetic information or characteristics (or those of a family member) or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.

description:
Job Description: Wound Care Nurse (Skilled Rehab Nursing Home)

Position Overview:

We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Wound Care Nurse to join our skilled rehab nursing home team. As a Wound Care Nurse, you will play a critical role in providing specialized care to patients with acute or chronic wounds. Your primary responsibility will be to assess, plan, implement, and evaluate wound care interventions for our residents, ensuring optimal healing and prevention of complications. The ideal candidate should have a strong clinical background in wound management and be knowledgeable about current wound care practices.

Responsibilities:

Wound Assessment and Planning:

Conduct comprehensive assessments of patients' wounds, considering factors such as wound type, size, location, tissue viability, and underlying health conditions.

Collaborate with the interdisciplinary team to develop individualized wound care plans, setting appropriate goals and interventions.

Continuously monitor and document the progress of wounds, modifying treatment plans as necessary.

Wound Care Interventions:

Perform specialized wound care procedures, such as wound cleansing, debridement, dressing selection, and application.

Administer topical medications and wound adjunctive therapies as prescribed by physicians.

Educate patients, families, and caregivers on proper wound care techniques and prevention strategies.

Ensure compliance with infection control practices and maintain a clean and sterile wound care environment.

Collaboration and Communication:

Collaborate with physicians, nurses, physical therapists, and other healthcare professionals to coordinate wound care interventions and interdisciplinary treatment plans.

Act as a resource person for staff members, providing guidance and education on wound care best practices.

Maintain accurate and detailed documentation of wound assessments, interventions, and outcomes.

Communicate effectively with patients and their families, addressing their concerns and providing emotional support.

Quality Improvement and Education:

Stay up-to-date with the latest wound care research, innovations, and evidence-based practices.

Participate in quality improvement initiatives, ensuring compliance with regulatory guidelines and best practices in wound care.

Conduct educational sessions for staff members, focusing on wound care prevention, identification, and treatment.

Qualifications:

Valid registered nursing (RN) license in the state of practice.

Minimum of 2 years of clinical experience as a wound care nurse, preferably in a skilled rehab nursing home or similar setting

In-depth knowledge of wound etiology, assessment techniques, staging, and evidence-based wound care interventions.

Proficient in wound documentation and understanding of electronic medical record systems.

Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to effectively interact with patients, families, and healthcare professionals.

Ability to work collaboratively within an interdisciplinary team.

Strong attention to detail and ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.

Commitment to providing compassionate and patient-centered care.

Working Conditions:

The Wound Care Nurse will primarily work in a skilled rehab nursing home environment. The role involves standing, walking, and bending for extended periods, as well as occasional lifting and positioning of patients. The nurse may be exposed to infectious diseases and hazardous materials. The position may require working evening, weekend, or holiday shifts to ensure continuity of care.

We offer competitive compensation packages, including benefits such as health insurance, retirement plans, and paid time off.
